citation.article-title: Ulvibacter litoralis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from the green alga Ulva fenestrata
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Ulvibacter (Ul.vi.bac′ter. N.L. fem. n. Ulva generic name of the green alga Ulva fenestrata; N.L. masc. n. bacter from Gr. n. bakterion rod; N.L. masc. n. Ulvibacter rod isolated from the green alga Ulva fenestrata).
Na+ ions are required for growth.
Cytochrome oxidase-, catalase- and alkaline phosphatase-positive.
Main cellular fatty acids are the straight- and branched-chain unsaturated fatty acids i-C15 : 0, i-C15 : 1, i-C16 : 0 3-OH and i-C17 : 0 3-OH.
As determined by 16S rDNA sequence analysis, the genus Ulvibacter is a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae within the phylum Cytophaga–Flavobacterium–Bacteroides.
The type species is Ulvibacter litoralis.
